info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 12 at 7:13PM CDT until July 13 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN COOK COUNTY... At 713 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms capable of producing tornadoes were located along a line extending from Skokie to River Forest, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. These dangerous storms will be near... Evanston, West Ridge, Rogers Park and Edgewater around 720 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these tornadic storms include South Lawndale, Logan Square, East Garfield Park, Chicago, Chicago Loop, West Town, Lincoln Park, Lake View, Bridgeport, Navy Pier, Northerly Island, Near West Side and Near North Side. This includes... Lincoln Park Zoo, Loyola University, Triton College, Northeastern Illinois University, Northwestern University, Soldier Field, University of Illinois Chicago, Wrigley Field, The Loop, Museum Campus, and Northerly Island. Including the following interstates... I-55 between mile markers 291 and 294. I-90 between mile markers 81 and 84. I-94 between mile markers 36 and 55. I-290 between mile markers 19 and 29. I-294 between mile markers 36 and 55. OEMC zones...TORNADO WARNING. 1...2...3...4...5...6...and 7. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
